item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, April 6, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Standard Ebooks: liberated ebooks, carefully produced for the true book lover (620 points | 143 comments)
2. The "S" in MCP Stands for Security (296 points | 71 comments)
3. Show HN: I built a Rust crate for running unsafe code safely (52 points | 35 comments)

6. Foundry (YC F24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
7. Thomas Rattigan, short-lived Commodore CEO (24 points | discuss)
8. Neutron Stars Hint at Another Dimension (43 points | 7 comments)

10. Blacksmithing and Lisp (84 points | 30 comments)
11. Taught me to build them. What was your start in computing? (19 points | 18 comments)

13. Lessons from open source in the Mexican government (198 points | 60 comments)
14. My Browser WASM't Prepared for This. Using DuckDB, Apache Arrow and Web Workers (71 points | 16 comments)

16. 'Netflix levy' would 'price out' consumers (5 points | 2 comments)

18. Switzerland's vinyl turntable roundabout: Unique road art (2019) (23 points | 4 comments)

20. The Llama 4 herd (1143 points | 577 comments)

22. The ADHD body double: A unique tool for getting things done (294 points | 176 comments)
23. Serving Vector Tiles, Fast (84 points | 16 comments)
24. Buffett: America's Growing Trade Deficit Is Selling the Nation Out from Under Us [pdf] (34 points | 23 comments)
25. Faster interpreters in Go: Catching up with C++ (205 points | 43 comments)
26. North America Is Dripping from Below, Geoscientists Discover (122 points | 37 comments)
27. Exeter's unassuming co-op worker leads double life as 'Lord of the Logos' (183 points | 62 comments)
28. A Vision for WebAssembly Support in Swift (196 points | 97 comments)
29. Dynamic Register Allocation on AMD's RDNA 4 GPU Architecture (119 points | 24 comments)
